Name: Guillermo Rauch
About / Bio Summary: Creator of Next.js. Built Socket.io, Mongoose, other open-source tools. Mission: make the web faster. Posts mix product vision with technical depth.
Relevance to Scott: Study how he frames developer pain in founder terms

Name: Jake Cooper
About / Bio Summary: Young founder who started Railway in college. Builder-in-public narrative. Developer infrastructure focus.
Relevance to Scott: Good model for lean startup energy

Name: Mitchell Hashimoto
About / Bio Summary: Created Terraform, Vagrant, Consul, Vault. Transitioned CEO to CTO to IC. Now building Ghostty terminal emulator independently.
Relevance to Scott: Shows how to list multiple high-impact projects

Name: Tom Preston-Werner
Company / Role: Co-Founder of GitHub / GP at Preston-Werner Ventures
About / Bio Summary: GitHub co-founder turned early-stage investor (175+ investments). Created TOML format. Clean founder-to-investor transition.
Relevance to Scott: Study founder-to-investor arc

Name: Christina Cacioppo
About / Bio Summary: Former Google APM. Built Vanta from idea to $2.45B compliance platform. Backed by Sequoia, Y Combinator, Goldman Sachs.
Relevance to Scott: Direct model: PM-to-founder arc

Name: Cristina Cordova
Headline (actual or best approximation): COO at Linear, leading Go-To-Market and Operations
About / Bio Summary: COO at Linear leading GTM and ops. Active angel investor (Notion, WorkOS, Metronome, Baseten, Ashby). Loves partnering with sharp opinionated technical teams building with conviction. Previously led partnerships at Notion and 7 years at Stripe building financial services partnerships.
Relevance to Scott: MOST RELEVANT: BD-to-exec positioning is exactly Scott's arc

Name: Elad Gil
About / Bio Summary: Author of High Growth Handbook. Ex-Google (VP), Color Health co-founder. Co-hosts No Priors podcast with Sarah Guo. Raising $1.5B+ fund.
Relevance to Scott: Study how he positions breadth of experience

Name: Jason Warner
Headline (actual or best approximation): Co-founder at Poolside | Board at Bridgewater & Atlassian | Fmr CTO GitHub, Heroku, Canonical
About / Bio Summary: Self-describes as average programmer who became GitHub CTO. Team oversaw creation of GitHub Copilot. Now building Poolside (AI for software development). Previously MD at Redpoint Ventures.
Relevance to Scott: Study the vulnerability + ambition combo

Name: Amjad Masad
About / Bio Summary: Mission: bring the next billion software creators online. Ex-Facebook JS infra tech lead (built/maintained Babel, Jest, React Native packager). Employee #1 at Codecademy. Believes software creation should be accessible regardless of place or economic status.
Relevance to Scott: Study how personal story amplifies founder narrative

Name: Zach Lloyd
About / Bio Summary: Ex-Google Principal Engineer (led Google Sheets). Built Warp in Rust to reinvent the terminal for modern developers. Technical depth pivoting to entrepreneurship.
Relevance to Scott: Study big-tech-to-founder transition

Name: Quinn Slack
Company / Role: Co-Founder & CEO at Sourcegraph / Amp Code
Headline (actual or best approximation): CEO and Co-Founder at Sourcegraph / Amp Code
About / Bio Summary: Stanford CS. Decade-long founder journey. Recently split Sourcegraph and Amp Code into separate companies. Consistent theme of making code accessible and understandable.
Relevance to Scott: Study long-game founder positioning

Name: Sarah Guo
About / Bio Summary: Used to do advanced R&D. Now invests in and works with startups. Youngest GP in Greylock history then founded Conviction (AI-focused fund). Backed Harvey, Mistral, Sierra. Co-hosts No Priors podcast. 2025 Midas Seed list.
Relevance to Scott: Study how she positions AI expertise for investors

Name: Dario Amodei
About / Bio Summary: TIME 100 Most Influential. Ex-VP Research at OpenAI. Neuroscience PhD from Princeton. Sparse but authoritative LinkedIn presence. Bridges deep research credentials with CEO leadership of $60B+ company.
Relevance to Scott: Study mission-driven safety positioning at scale

Name: Daniela Amodei
About / Bio Summary: Non-technical co-founder of leading AI safety company. Ex-VP Operations at Stripe. Humanities background. Recently quoted: studying humanities will be 'more important than ever' in the age of AI.
Relevance to Scott: MOST RELEVANT: Non-technical co-founder in AI safety

Name: Dan Hendrycks
About / Bio Summary: Founded the Center for AI Safety. Helped draft the AI extinction risk statement signed by hundreds of leaders. Academic credentials plus real-world policy impact. Safety adviser at xAI.
Relevance to Scott: Study how safety mission translates to LinkedIn presence

Name: Helen Toner
Company / Role: Director of Strategy at Georgetown CSET
Headline (actual or best approximation): Director of Strategy at Georgetown CSET
About / Bio Summary: Former OpenAI board member. Chemical engineering background pivoted to AI safety and governance. Oxford and Georgetown policy expertise. Compelling career-pivot narrative.
Relevance to Scott: Study career-pivot-to-AI-safety framing

Name: Ian Hogarth
Company / Role: Chair of UK AI Safety Institute / Co-Founder at Plural
Headline (actual or best approximation): Chair UK AI Safety Institute, Co-founder Plural, Co-founder Songkick
About / Bio Summary: TIME 100 Most Influential in AI (2023). Balances entrepreneur (Songkick founder), investor (150+ companies via Plural), and government advisor roles. Co-authors annual State of AI report.
Relevance to Scott: Study how to position multiple roles credibly

Name: Jeremie Harris
About / Bio Summary: Promotes responsible AI R&D by designing safeguards against AI-driven national security threats. Physics PhD. Authored AI safety report for US government. Bestselling author and podcast host.
Relevance to Scott: Study policy-meets-startup positioning

Name: Claire Vo
Company / Role: CPO at LaunchDarkly / Founder of ChatPRD
Headline (actual or best approximation): Chief Product Officer at LaunchDarkly | Building ChatPRD.ai | Startups, Leadership, Product x Engineering, and AI
About / Bio Summary: PM + Eng + AI + startups. 3x CPO (LaunchDarkly, Color Health, Optimizely). Started career as copywriter. Founded ChatPRD (bootstrapped, #1 AI tool for PMs). Hosts 'How I AI' podcast. Based in SF.
Relevance to Scott: MOST RELEVANT: Non-technical origin to technical builder arc

Name: Kanjun Qiu
About / Bio Summary: First Chief of Staff at Dropbox (~age 22). Founded Sourceress. Now leading Imbue ($230M raised AI research lab building coding agent tools). Forbes 30 Under 30. MIT CS.
Relevance to Scott: Study how diverse experience feeds into AI founder credibility
